description: conical vase with short, slightly flaring foot; brown; primitive looking figures incised and raised around body
medium: Stoneware with sgraffito and modeled decoration
text: This vase is an outstanding example of the larger sgraffito-decorated forms the Scheiers were perfecting around 1960.  Like the bowl from this period in the collection of the Minnesota Museum of American Art (shown nearby), the piece is a substantial canvas for a band of figures enclosed in ovoid shapes--here the females "split" into two male figures, an apparent reference to the act of procreation or childbirth.
title: Footed vase with figure design
